title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: travisdea
review: The writing in this show is the worst. The animation is fine, the characters are bad, the dialog is terrible there's no progression to the story it's just story beats that keep going and then... Spiderman doesn't make his costume, uncle Ben is already dead his whole hero journey belongs to someone else. It's so weird they acknowledge the events of Civil War but like Spiderman wasn't involved in the airport. There's a CW level drama in this kids show, like at one point Peter's best friend is being racially profiled it's so goofy. I know why this sat in the can for over 3 years it's utterly unwatchable.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: tabttbat
review_title: "6.6? Really? This show deserves a higher score."
review:
I don't understand why fans are so hostile to a new animation.

Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man. Judging from the two episodes released so far, the quality is no less than that of Spectacular Spider-Man in 2008 and the Spider-Man animated series in 1994.

This is a Spider-Man story in a parallel universe, not a traditional Spider-Man story.

From the perspective of the play, the thought and ingenuity put into the first episode made the first episode so outstanding. It almost covers all the elements of Spider-Man adaptations.

Telling the story of Spider-Man from the perspective of a friendly neighbor gave me a big surprise. I like that Spider-Man gave the thief a second chance after catching her. I like Peter's daily life as a high school student. I like the interaction between Aunt May and Peter. I like that Lonnie is still strong in such a chaotic neighborhood.

The title cover of each episode is different. The arrangement of the music in the performance makes me very happy when watching Spider-Man swinging in city.

The second episode is about how Peter, a newcomer, balances heroism and daily life. The firefighting plot is really a classic in the Spider-Man story, and the screenwriter can still play new ideas in the classic.

The fight in the pet store is really interesting. Rescuing dogs, pet fish and birds really makes this character a lot cuter.

In short, I really think this is going to be a great Spider-Man show. When I saw the imdb rating, I was really confused by the low score. It deserves a higher score.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: markjohnsonii
review_title: Hard pass on this new installment in the Spider-Man content universe.
review: I don't even know where to start with this show... The episodes are written with weak character motivations. There are low stakes. This whole thing is uninteresting and takes zero risks in its storytelling and world building. The animation looks fine, but it's not unique and certainly not impressive. Regardless if you are new to Spider-Man, or you are showing this to your kids for the first time, or even if you are a Spider-Man super fan, i'd recommend you watch previous Spider-Man shows because this new incarnation is a weak blend of mediocre writing and overall a "lesser son of greater sires".

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: n00bmast3r69
review: I saw all episodes of Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man. It's not terrible, but it's not that good either. I would have preferred a Spider-Man '98 or a Spectacular Spider-Man season 3. This show, though entertaining at times, is overall boring in my opinion. The animation looks weird, some of the characters aren't that interesting, and now, I don't want to get all political or anything, but they made lazy race-swaps on Harry and Norman Osborn. It just felt pointless and stupid to do it. Anyways... I liked the tombstone storyline, it was pretty cool and all. I'm however, pretty disappointed that this isn't an MCU Spider-Man origin story. So overall, it's decent, but generic.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: lucas_pozzuto
review: This is not a show for Spider-Man fans. This is slop for MCU fans who will watch anything marvel/marvel animation puts out. The animation is frankly embarrassing, the dialogue is dry and unrealistic. The decision to have Uncle Ben already having died before the spider bite occurs is an intentional decision and a slap in the face to spider-man fans. This show teaches us nothing of becoming a responsible, good person in the face of tragedy. This show teaches us that Peter Parker is just innately good, as everyone should be, and being a superhero is just fun! PLEASE WATCH SPECTACULAR SPIDER-MAN!!

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: erick-hernandez
review:
Who is this series even for? It skews young - more so than even the recent and utterly fantastic X-Men 97, only shorn of that shows more adult complexity and storylines - but then it peppers in a Dumb and Dumber reference (watch out for the live comments on the antagonist's live stream for Parker's first bad guy takedown...) which likely only older fans will pick up. And yet immediately its straight back to its overly simplistic narrative and stylings. Again, who is this show for? The casual viewer, the hardcore MCU fan, the young, the more mature...it's difficult to gauge, feeling like it's for no-one as opposed to what it was likely going for, to be for everyone. It's a strange show to understand why its been included as mot just part of the MCU's Phase 5 but its premiere - possibly to act as a soft introduction for later Phase 5 characters (Charlie Cox and Vincent D'Onofrio from Daredevil Born Again are included in the voice cast for the series)? - as it feels like a hard turn back into the bland and the slightly dull of the more unsuccessful entries of the previous Phase as opposed to something bold and new to let Kevin Feige et al show us that the MCU is back on course after a series of critically mauled misfires and burgeoning audience apathy.

Taken on its own merits, this is...fine. Its another Spider-Man origin story, albeit under a slightly different guise...but that's its main problem. It gets the benefit of the doubt after a fairly entertaining but utterly uninspired hour of television, with hopefully little of the meat of the narrative arc of the season revealed in any way yet...but so far, this feels like only a slightly different Spider-Man. And if this Spider-Man is only going to be slightly different, its as I said right at the beginning of this review...why?

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: kinseyliam
review:
If you have a Disney+ subscription, or anything like that, let me give a note, Don't Watch 'Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man'.

This show, is awful. Like so bad. It deserves to be forgotten. The writing, slow. The characters, trash (except for the Spider-Man characters) The actor for Peter in this, not Tom Holland. And the animation, SUCKS! It should be 2D and capture the aesthetic of the original comics made by Stan Lee and Steve Ditko. It did the comic part, but the animation is 3D and is UGLY. UGLY!!! So if you're a Spider-Man fan and want to watch something new based on this iconic character, you're better off watching the movies.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: Astrorobert7
review:
The animation was really unique along with the transitions like an moving comic book, with all the best designs of the characters and the new take on spider-man this gives Batman Caped Crusader and My Adventures with Superman a new brother on the black, sure many people would not like the animation but this gives way great respect for Steve Ditko on your friendly neighborhood spider-man, I really really hope and appreciate Marvel taking a chance on the greatest characters to a new and exciting world of the classic and funny superhero, and to all the haters out there you are definitely missing out on this

GO SPIDEY.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: reyleroland
review: "Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man" stands out with its blend of classic comic book aesthetics and modern animation techniques. Unlike many short-form superhero animations aimed at younger audiences, this series avoids simplistic storytelling and childish dialogue. Instead, it delivers well-developed characters, engaging narratives, and visually striking action sequences. By emphasizing Spider-Man's friendly neighborhood persona, it appeals to both younger and older audiences. With its stylized animation and mature storytelling, the show offers an enjoyable experience not just for "iPad kids" but for Marvel fans of all ages. I hope they dont mess this up.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: AlienRobotZombieOverlord
review: I was not expecting much with this show. I tend to dislike animation, as I think it is really geared towards kids and doesn't do a good job with character development. However, this show has surprised me so far. Only the first two episodes have aired so far, but it's off to a great start. The animation is unique and fluid, and the story-telling has been interesting. I feel like we've gotten to know not just Spidey but also his cast of supporting characters in just this short amount of time. The dialogue is sharp, and the pacing is crisp -- I put it on as background noise, but found myself watching intently to see what was happening. And I'm ready for more. I can see a lot of story-telling potential already set up. It's following a lot of the classic Spider-Man beats -- and yet charting a completely original direction. As someone who's been on the Spider-Man train for over 5 decades now, I didn't think I'd be saying this, but I'm really excited to see what comes next!

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: JCARTER_ThatReviewGuy
review_title: A great "Saturday Morning" cartoon...but nothing beyond that
review: I'm not entirely sure who this show is for. While it can be simplified down to a "fun" new Spider-Man animated show, it unfortunately can't really be described as anything more than that. The show has the feel of a Saturday morning cartoon, which is totally fine, but it feels empty if you look for anything beyond that. The show's animation, and story (at least so far) pale in comparison to other new animated properties such as X-Men 97', and the beloved Spider-Verse movies. Speaking of X-Men 97' and the Spider-Verse films, those properties feel like they have something to say, or that they want to bring something new to the world of animation, superhero's, comics, etc. In comparison, Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man feels bland and lacking of anything that makes it its own. In the first two episodes, the show retreads Spider-man's origin story, and has a fun mirroring of Captain America Civil War, but again...there's nothing new here. All in all, it has the perfect Saturday morning cartoon vibe, but don't look for anything beyond that. 6/10.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: jojomathias
review_title: A breath of fresh air for Marvel
review: A lot of marvel fans are so toxic nowadays and wait anxiously by their computer screens ready to complain about anything and everything that marvel releases, but i've had a lot of fun with this series, and it's such a new breath of fresh air for marvel, and this is such a fun series thus far. I thought it was really good, some people will complain, but all I can say is ignore the bad reviews and watch it for yourself. If you take everything seriously then you will never be able to have any fun, and that's the point of TV: entertainment. So before you criticise anything or give it one star, please watch it. If it's not your thing then fair enough, but personally I love it.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: TheProtagonist123
review:
This show is one of the better recent products the MCU has delivered and I'm shocked at the amount of negative reviews.

The animation is fantastic, mixing simple images with complex movements. It's very clean animation-wise compared to recent animated hits like the Spiderverse series and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Mutant Mayhem. It's unique enough to help the show stand out while staying simple enough to take nothing away from the other well done aspects.

I've also been very impressed with the voice acting all around. Many of the voice actors appear to be paying homage to the voices we are used to, almost putting their own take on those who came before them.

Overall this is worthy of a watch.

75%.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: djranu26
review_title: Trust me. Watch till 8th episode. Your patience will pay off.
review:
Rest, please watch... Dont waste your time searching for the right review. It's fun!

I am writing this review because i have to cover the base word limit. Nothing important below there. That's just me explaining why i am loving watching this show. No spoilers...just my happy thoughts about the show.

Jusy finished watching EP 8. What a banger episode. The Nostalgia, the character development, the story arch changing. And you actually feel for the characters, their relationships with each other. And Peter's dilemma of choosing the side that with humour.

A very lighthearted but beautiful watch.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: thatonewimpykid
review_title: Spider-Man, Spider-Man, Does Whatever A Spider Can
review:
I watched the first season premiere of Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man on Disney+ on January 29, 2025.

Coming into the show, I had extremely low expectations. I thought the animation looked bad. I didn't like some of the comments that the main actor had made. I was a little disappointed when I found out it was no longer a prequel to the MCU Spider-Man. But all of this changed the moment I finished the first two episodes.

The animation looks way better than the trailer made it look. The voice acting and writing is on point and I was engaged throughout both episodes. Having Nico be Peter's best friend actually works well, although I do want Harry and Peter to eventually end up being close friends.

Something that I didn't like was that they unnecessarily race and gender swapped a couple of characters, but honestly it's not that noticeable and as long as you don't get super upset about that kind of thing, it's fine. Even though the animation looks way better than the trailer showed, it still does look choppy and wonky at times but the story makes up for it.

If you're a Spider-Man fan, definitely give this a watch. I'd say it's worth it. I'm excited for the new batch of episodes.

9/10

-Steele Wyndham.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: veggie_willymass
review: Have a feeling this show is gonna get review bombed so I'm posting a review here. The show only has two episodes out so can't really judge it overall but so far it's been pretty good with the first episode even being great! Or should I say amazing? Anyway, the character changes such as who Peter's love interest is work well for his character and the supporting cast are all pretty solid. Especially love the mature depth they went with Lonnie's character. So glad that this may just end up being THE Spider-Man cartoon for a whole new generation just as Spectacular Spider-Man was for me as a kid. Assuming parents are fine with the drops of H-E double hockey sticks lol. Really interested to see where they take things in episode 3.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: oldmcdonnell
review_title: Not interested in "my alt-right neighborhood spiderman"
review: If Hudson Thames wants to represent a white supremacist, alt-right Spider-Man, he can go ahead, I am not interested. This new animated series, which supposedly follows Peter Parker on his journey to becoming Spider-Man in the MCU, feels like a shallow attempt to cash in on the character's legacy rather than a genuine celebration of his comic book roots. The animation style, while trying to be nostalgic, comes off as cheap and uninspired, lacking the depth and creativity that made the early comics so iconic. The storytelling is disjointed, and the characters feel flat, with none of the emotional resonance that has made Spider-Man such a beloved figure. Instead of offering a fresh take, this series feels like a missed opportunity, failing to capture the essence of what makes Peter Parker's story so compelling. Save yourself the disappointment and revisit the original comics or even the older animated series-they do a far better job of honoring the web-slinger's legacy.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: deborajhaflongbar-57945
review_title: A new spiderman but is it still peter?
review:
Honestly in contrast to what people say animation and art style is nice but unfortunately this doesn't feel like peter . The show has removed 80% of the original cast who were very influential in Peter's early years and replaced them with already established characters thar feels more like Miles's friend group than peter's. There is no uncle ben meaning the whole quote " with great power comes great responsibility " bares not the same weight behind it cause in the original peters direct action is linked to it.

And worst of all peter and spiderman shouldn't have the same personality . Google it.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: boxepicreviews
review_title: Shameless knock-off to My Adventures with Superman.
review:
Right as Toonami's My Adventures with Superman drops. Disney just tries to get into the trend by dropping this shameless knockoff. There's some good things about this show, but at the same time a ton of horrible things about this show. Like the Animation and art style feels janky. But the Voice acting and Writing however. It's actually kinda good. One thing I genially don't like about this is how they decided to just murder the Disney XD original Ultimate Spiderman and just have this slop that feels AI Generated.

Honestly though. This show feels like I'm watching the entire spiderman movie with multiple lobotomies. 4/10. Would not recommend.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: Billy D.-2
review_title: A perfect blend of the old and the new.
review: As a person who has been around Spiderman since the beginning, I can say this is a perfect mix of the old and the new. The original Peter Paker was smart but not an actual nerd. This is the Peter Parker updated for the 21st century so I guess you can't be smart without being a nerd. This means Parker will do some stupid things the original Parker would never consider. Since we are in a diverse culture I understand the changes in the supporting characters. The animation style is on point with the earlier comic books which is a nice touch and better than the original cartoon of the 60's. I am enjoying this version of Spiderman and can respect the vision they are trying to make.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: vvb12
review_title: Please watch all 10 episodes before even thinking of writing a review here. This show deserves better rating!
review:
I was very skeptical about this show since it was announced. TBH, even its trailer and the lack of hype around it made me almost skip this show, but I am glad I gave it a chance!

I am a big Spider-Man fan, so I have watched or at least know about many different shows, movies, and comics about Spider-Man. Trust me when I say the show gets better after the first two episodes.

I like their decision not to make this show feature in the main MCU timeline, so we are getting many unexpected and less popular characters from the Spider-Man stories!

I just finished all ten episodes, and I absolutely enjoyed this show. The episodes surprisingly felt like a breath of fresh air. There was something exciting in each episode, and the fact that they released the entire season in sets of two or three episodes per week was a good decision. Other shows, especially superhero-related shows, should release episodes like this, IMO.

Though I am praising this show, there are a few things that some people may not like, or this show might not feel enjoyable to them, but this is a different take on the same character we all know and love. With MCU having the rights to almost all of their crucial characters, I am glad they are using them all without messing with the main timeline.

The animation style is not something I really liked, but I got used to it after some time. Though they have made some changes to a few characters' origins and appearances, I feel it is more like the Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse decision, where they are basically just considering a different timeline than the most common one.

I am excited about the next season, and I just hope they do not make fans wait too long. I recommend you give this a shot, but if you do, please watch more than three episodes.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: elliotbreton
review:
The show has so much potential, and it is a breath of fresh air for Spider-Man since the 2017 Disney TV show. It might not have the greatest animation style ever seen in a Spider-Man series, but it is nonetheless somewhat original. I hope they don't mess this one up because I truly believe Disney is capable of doing something right for the character. It might not be The Spectacular Spider-Man, but it is still Spider-Man, and they have the opportunity to honor the character.

Disney is capable of great things, and I hope they prove my point after the first two episodes. You should definitely give it a shot and see what you might be missing.

This review reflects my personal opinion, and I can guarantee that my perspective will remain the same in the near future. Even if I don't expect my opinion to change, I believe Disney is finally on the right track with the character!

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: roxxie-72006
review_title: A great addition to the Spider verse
review: This show is a representation of how people struggle in the real world and Spider-Man is suppose to be a hero that gets back next matter what and he gives us hope for what we can't do and this show even shows How people today are be disrespected like in the real world and I love the animation style that looks like it is in a actual comic while taking elements like the Punching and Kicking also I love how Doc Connors is a Woman also Harry and Norman are great Characters and I can't wait to see other villains like Doc Ock, Scorpion, Venom and I hope Green Goblin in it because you can't have Spider-Man without Green Goblin but I love the Diversity of the characters and I love mix between a new story and a familiar one to understand that "with great power comes great Responsibility" and can't wait for the whole show.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: pugleon
review: This is about as bad as it gets. Spideys friends are all DEI plants. The rich guy, the jock all DEI swaps. The majority of his friends are multicultural swaps. The music for the show. I mean. Just make Miles Morales. Which was actually a fantastic movie. And game. And had amazing visuals and music and was a cultural phenomenon and sensation. This is just to bring certain people down on purpose and we all know whos behind it and why. And who was placed in which roles and why. Stop paying for Disney and they'll wise up to this stuff. And Disney if you are listening we're all wide awake to this stuff. If you wanna go broke keep it up.

title: Your Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man
author: shakedatjunk
review:
I don't like r4ceswaps either, but disregarding an entire show & everyone who worked on it over one thing is absolutely ridiculous. Also, bl4ck people exist, g4y people exist(referring to Niko & Lonnie Lincoln) also police racially profiling absolutely exists, so if you negatively rate this show or downvote this review based on just that you're either a bigot or an idiot.

This show is already miles better than Far From Home & shaping up to be better than Homecoming as well. This has so much stuff that any Spider-Man fan could want. The characters & intrigue have also been done very well. It's cool to just see Peter doing classic Spider-Man things with Peter Parker problems that those comics have always highlighted so well to make him relatable to people. The animation is a bit jarring but the action scenes & swinging scenes are amazing they're so dynamic with awesome camera movements, not to mention the comic panel editing & cool transitions. I get why they went with this style so they could have awesome fights & swing scenes within a reasonable budget, which the MCU Spider-Man movies do not have. HC & FFH are some of the most sauceless superhero movies ever & the action & overall visual style of this show is so much better. Also Peter is in New York doing Spider-Man stuff which is awesome & he does basically none of that in FFH.

It's pretty annoying how this show already has some low ratings & review bombing by idiots because these shallow dumbos are rating it without even watching it & just basing it off the jarring animation style. It's pretty hilarious because people are so quick to criticize the look of animation but none of these people are actually smart enough to criticize live action stuff for bad cinematography, like most of the MCU has. Most of the MCU is bad visually, & if you think this is well then it fits perfectly in line with the MCU visually. But again none of these people are actually smart enough to tell good cinematography from bad because they're not actual film fans they just love theme park rides which the MCU is. They're so confident to talk about animation because it's easy to tell differences but when it comes to live action stuff they're none the wiser because they don't have an eye for artistry, they couldn't tell The Batman visuals apart from Avengers 1(which looks like a made for TV movie).

If this show was in crappy cinematography live action form all these smooth brains would be going bananas over it because this show gives you most of what you would want from a Spider-Man property.

People need to actually watch this show & pay attention to the nuances instead of only focusing on the animation & just rating it based off short clips they see on the internet. It's a very good show & its review bombing on here is very disappointing because you can tell people are judging it without watching it because they're just not smart & a lot of them think animation is for kids which is a whole other level of stupid. This show is on the same maturity level as the MCU Spider-Man movies as well as most of the MCU.

Watch this show & enjoy it because it is pretty sick.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: Sancler
review_title: HUGE fan of the originals, but forever immune to hypes...
review:
Daredevil was without any doubt the best thing ever to come out of MCU, along with The Punisher. I'm also a huge fan of d'Onofrio, who managed to portray one of the (if not the) best ''super''villain on TV. I've been cautiously optimistic ever since the announcement of its return, but now it's finally here and...

Rushed plot. Scenes and dialogue seem cut short. Too much cramped in 1 episode, resulting in a lack of suspense and character building. Fight scenes seem slowish and at times even silly as if they're cuddling. It's just trying way too hard to match the original, but failing miserably. The production just feels cheap overall, cutting corners all-over. Even the soundtrack and effects seem rushed.

I really wanted it to continue on with the level of quality from the originals, but it simply doesn't. The ratings and reviews here are once again ridiculous. It seems people's standards have been lowered to such an extend that they truly don't know any better any more, or they simply can't afford themselves to feel disappointed. Not that it's bad, but it's quite evident Disney just can't seem to do any thing other than destroy and dumb down. Having some extra violence and blood still doesn't save you from a lack of substance. I really can't be bothered watching any further, it's just that stale compared to the originals.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: Belnick
review_title: Netflix Daredevil was much better(so far)
review:
Review for episode 1 and 2.

I have no problem with the early death in the show, but I do have a problem with the horrible CGI and the really bad/weak fight choreography. They tried to mix in CGI in to physical stunt or tried to make the physical stunt CGI? It looked really bad, like it was sped up like the old fight scenes in Sean Connery James Bond movies....... Vanessa cuckolding Kingpin? The one woman we expected to NEVER give up on Kingpin....and even worse, Kingpin is okey with it.....and tell her that he loves her and does not want to lose her....disgusting, drop her The Acting is fine.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: TheWatcher17
review_title: The cinematic beauty of the Netflix version is gone :(
review: Being a HUGE fan of the original series on Netflix, I knew it was going to bad news when Disney announced this series, given their reputation with their Marvel content. First of all, I'm super glad to get the cast and characters back on screen. But that's about it. It was really difficult to watch. The editing is all over the place with lots of fast cuts, and using way too much low-quality CGI for even small fight scenes or even swinging around, when before they used to have talented stunt work and beautiful cinematography and intense fight choreography that was often shot in one take. Also, now the camera quality seems lower quality, the lighting is way too bright for night scenes, and the set designs look like low budget stages instead of stunning on-location shots like they used to do. The dialog seems very choppy and rushed as well, like the cuts are very obvious, whereas before it was more paced and realistic. Pretty much everything I loved about the original series is gone, the only saving grace is the wonderful original cast. I'll keep watching and hoping it gets better, but honestly with Disney+'s reputation with their Marvel shows, I'm not getting my hopes up.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: lukemerciernc
review:
Can't believe we have this gem back and running. What a crazy way to begin the new series. I am in shock. What a risky diversion of expectations. The writers definitely took their care here and we are so lucky they did. Much better than expected and true to the original. The cinematography is a little bit different but the core concepts are the same as the original series.

The episode starts with possibly one of the fastest, most intense paces I have ever seen. This both excited and intrigued me as I was hoping to avoid needless exposition.

Can't wait to see what this series has in store. We could be looking at a perfect sequel-series.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: Sjamanen
review_title: Massive Downgrade compared to the original seasons
review:
This is nowhere near the same quality as the ¬´original¬ª Daredevil (first 3 seasons).. Some of the actors feel misplaced/miscast.. CGI at times is distractingly weak and the fight sequences are nowhere near as good as they were in the ¬´original¬ª. This also brings me to the cinematography which at times is interesting, but mostly too bright and very bland. Compared to the contrast/shadow heavy, dark and colorful cinematography of the ¬´original¬ª seasons.

Marvel have obviously been struggling since Avengers Endgame, and like most of the movies and especially tv shows (except for Loki), this is not surprisingly another disappointing Disney+ product.

I hope it somehow can surprise me and develop a good plot/story over the next few episodes. But when it comes to the overall production of the show its been fairly disappointing, so far..

7/10 (could change)

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: rohan-steezy
review_title: It's not like the Netflix Daredevil
review:
As I've watched 7 episodes of Daredevil: Born Again, I feel like something was quite off. I don't know exactly what, maybe it's the fast pacing, the rushed dialogues, the toned-down antagonist, and especially the lack of brutal fights, grittiness, and those darker tones.

So I started rewatching the Netflix version, and damn, it just felt so much more layered. The character introductions actually felt connected to the audience. I don't know, maybe it's just me. I've never read the comics, so I'm not sure if this newer tone is closer to the source material or not.

But for me, and honestly, for a lot of people, the Netflix version is the Daredevil we fell in love with. That depth, that grittiness, the emotional weight... it's kind of missing from the Disney one.

Especially with all the disappointing Marvel shows that have dropped on Disney+ most of which became forgettable within a week, except Loki and WandaVision, and that's mainly because those characters were already loved.

I just feel like people are too scared to admit that Daredevil: Born Again isn't really that good, especially because Daredevil has become such a beloved character.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: joemosh
review_title: 6 years of waiting for rushed writing
review:
This is the worst pacing of any Disney+ original show I've ever witnessed.

The entire opening sequence of the first episode should have taken place over the course of at least half a season if not more. The ramifications of what happens before the Daredevil opening credits rolled are more impactful on the world of Daredevil than anything that occurred in the first 3 entire seasons of the Netflix series.

Kevin Feige likely sits at home feeling he's giving the fans what they've been waiting for... but simply bringing back the original cast is not going to satisfy the storytelling and drama the show's fans ultimately desire.

2 stars... 1 star granted purely for bringing back the OG cast.

Born Again appears dead on arrival.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: khuraym
review_title: One of the best shows if it carries on and is like the original
review:
One of the standout aspects of the show is its evolution of Daredevil's character, presenting him more prominently as a superhero. This shift aligns closely with the comic book portrayal, offering fans a fresh yet familiar experience. The action sequences set a new standard within the MCU, with meticulously choreographed fight scenes that are both thrilling and immersive.

Beyond the action, the series delves into the complexities of its characters. Matt Murdock's internal struggles and moral dilemmas are portrayed with depth, making his journey compelling. The narrative also explores the intricate relationship between Murdock and Fisk, adding layers to the storytelling.

The return of key characters, including Deborah Ann Woll as Karen Page and Elden Henson as Foggy Nelson, enriches the narrative, providing continuity and depth to the storyline.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: tresm87
review_title: After 6 long years we are Born Again into the chaos of an even hotter Hell's Kitchen.
review:
When the original series first came out on Netflix, almost a decade ago, it revolutionized comic adaptation to series format. There had never been a comic series that came like it before that captivated more than most full length films did or still do. For my taste it was the best thing in the Marvel universe to ever come out. The grittiness , the sheer brutality, and heart of the characters made it shine brighter than anyone could've imagined.

When Disney acquired Marvel, the show was put on a hiatus along with all the other Netflix marvel series. No one knew if we'd see this brilliant version of daredevil and punisher again. Thankfully they made the right choice and brought them both back and I can honestly say once again, it has reignited the MCU in much needed fashion.

It starts off where it ended with such a fluidity and continuation of quality. It's actually uncanny how close they managed to come. All the actors are still top-notch and on top of their game. The characterization is just so impeccably written it's flabbergasting. With an even bigger budget, the action sequences, and overall dynamo has been upped to insane levels. The level of production quality on this is truly mind blowing. Even though we're only two episodes and it's safe to say that we have definitely been born again into witnessing greatness in the MCU after a long time of not. I cannot wait to see what else happens this season and cannot wait what they do with the punisher project that will follow..

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: eitvaimaligo
review:
I just want to clarify that I just watched only the first episode and I'm considering not watching further in, so my review is purely based on episode 1. I got the nostalgia bait, you see Mat, Karen, Foggy it's all well and good, time has passed, things have progressed, but pretty quickly you discover that this isn't the same show that you are used to, the characters are similar, not the same, the vibe is similar, not the same, everything is just a pale imitation with the hopes that it's an improvement, but sadly it isn't. It's watchable, Charlie Cox is amazing once again, but they just kill everything with shotty CGI, bad choreography, they just packed a lot of things in very short amount of time that should have been amazing, but the old show would have given time for these events, would have had build up, reason, but here things just happen, don't ask questions, just consume product and get excited for the next product. I'm happy overall that they made this, but generally pretty dissapointing start.

Now 7 episodes in, just give it a chance ! I will die on the hill that Netflix did a better job, but it becomes a worthy succesor, it really does get better, so much better ! Worth watching !

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: willyjwm-85251
review:
I created a user profile just to make this review. As a huge fan of the original series I was super pumped hearing all the actors talk about how it was a return to form and how they reshot it and made it more grounded and gritty and blah blah.

It's not. Go watch 20 minutes and you'll see all you need to see. Too much CGI, terrible fight sequences, and incredibly unrealistic situations - AND they throw out his whole inner battle within the first 20 minutes - like the whole basis for what and who Daredevil is gets tossed off a roof in the first act!

See for yourself - like you owe it that much - but if you're like me and you were a real fan of what the first three seasons offered, you'll know - just like me - within the first 20 minutes that this is NOT the Daredevil we deserve. And don't listen to these bot reviews, it's honestly pathetic how much money these companies will put into building up bad product, but they won't use that money to make the product better.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: tale-schmitt
review:
For some reasons, the writers of both this and Severance seem to have forgotten the fundamental of all dramatic writing: what is the story about? On episode to episode basis this comes down to this: what does the protagonist want?

Watching this show - and we are almost at half point of the season - I don't have an idea. Matt Murdock doesn't really seem to want to everything, he just is and goes with the flow. The story has no premise, no goal towards which the audience knows it goes. In other words, there's no story arc.

Fisk has a hint of story arc but even he doesn't have an overarching goal. He wants to make New York better, but that's really vague and that's not a personal goal which every character needs. And if it is, then the writers should us why it is personal to him.

Without basic motivation, this is pretty boring to watch. Actors are doing pretty fine job, Cox especially. But without substance.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: IAMDB_
review:
The series begins with one of the clunkiest action sequences I've ever had the 'pleasure' of watching; set within a framework that after a 6 and a half year hiatus felt almost alien and most certainly disjointed.

The rest of the episode carries through consisting mostly of promotional scenes we've already seen, rounded out by the all too typical fanfare one should come to expect.

None of this would be some compromising issue on it's own, although when put into the context of the existing art direction, or rather, lack thereof, the entirety winds up coming off almost as more of a fan-piece, than some mult-xillion dollar production.

Perhaps I'll find myself pleasantly surprised by that which has yet to be released, or perhaps the decade since the release of the original has jaded me beyond compare. Either way, suffice to say, whatever spark the original had that lead to an entire mini-universe surrounding it, definitely didn't hit me upside the head.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: Kevinwalker77
review_title: After going back and re-watching the original series, Born Again just felt lacking
review:
The original series was one of my favorite TV shows of all time. The third season was absolutely phenomenal. It had a grittiness to it, dark and dreary, adult, and a season long story line with recurring meaningful characters.

Born Again has been tainted with what a lot of the more recent Marvel shows have: a disjointed plot, a lack of a vision, and flat writing. 5 mins in Foggy's dead, 10 mins later Karen is gone for good. 20 mins later, it's all sunshine and rainbows. 2nd episode in, Kingpin is somehow in marriage counseling. What the heck is going on?!?

If I hadn't just watched the original series, this probably would have gotten a higher rating. Alas, because we have something to compare it to, it fell woefully short.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: yehiasayed-75625
review_title: They totally missed the netflix vibe
review: Guys , i like the writing, pacing is good, and overall i like their work with wilson fisk, but i feel like there is some useless characters introduced, foggies death wasn't as sad as they could have made it ,also they messed up vanessa pretty bad, like i used to like her but I already hate her now. I wint forgive for this cinematography, what the hell!!. Like cgi is 0/10 , sometimes the camera isn't even still like it's being filmed by rookies, and the worst part, THE MUSIC, like if the runtime of an episode is 45 minutes,30 minutes of them will contain music. One last thing , how could you mess up dex saying "Hello karen" like that . I hope this season is salvaged by the end and to see better results in season 2.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: specularpotato
review:
I've been a long time fan of the original Daredevil show for over 5 years. Me and thousands others have been waiting for Matt Murdock to return for nearly a decade and today I can confidently say, he's back.

Daredevil: Born Again is amazing. It entirely keeps up with the original show. While not as good as seasons 1, or 3, it's easily comparable to the show overall and stands on its own two feet.

The pacing is much faster than the original show which took some getting used to, but considering the shorter 9-episode format and the fact that the show is catching us up to the present timeline it's a welcome addition to the content.

The cinematography of the show is one of the best upgrades. Visually, it's beautiful and you can tell they really put their whole souls into this.

Charlie Cox and Vincent put their entire hearts into their performances and they do not disappoint whatsoever.

Brilliant.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: AlBroMedia
review_title: Not the original, but there's hope.
review: After just binging the original Daredevil show, I can more easily compare and see the differences between the original and Born Again. The production is surprisingly not as good and reshoots are noticeable, even though the budget is probably much higher than the original pilot from 2015. Editing, pacing, musical score/ soundtrack and CGI are all over the place. The CG Daredevil swinging building to building is distracting, as opposed to the grounded practical look of the original. Combat between DD and a character just doesn't feel as well done. I need to remind myself this is made by an almost completely new team at Disney as opposed to Netflix. There are GREAT character moments in this first episode, but some moments are rushed. I still have hope this can be a good show. I LOVE Daredevil, as I gave the original show a 9.1/10 overall. Let's see what Disney can do.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: rodrickhilarian-62597
review_title: Look how they massacred my boy.
review: "Daredevil: Born Again" feels like a big letdown compared to the Netflix version. The fight sequences are more generic and rely heavily on CGI, whereas they felt raw, intense, and grounded when Netflix was producing it. The storytelling feels rushed-they killed Foggy in the first episode, which was a huge mistake-and the characters lack depth. Matt Murdock's internal struggles and moral complexity, which were central to the original, are barely explored. Disney took away what made Daredevil unique-its rawness, emotional weight, and street-level realism. The Netflix series was a masterpiece, with its dark tone, compelling villains like Kingpin and Punisher, and a sense of consequence. This reboot feels like a watered-down, corporate version, missing the heart and soul that made the original so beloved. It's a shadow of what it could have been, and fans deserved better.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: quinntree-62536
review:
Daredevil is *back*, and I'm honestly loving it. *Born Again* delivers gritty street-level storytelling with the grounded tone fans of the original Netflix series have been craving. Charlie Cox slips back into the role like he never left - conflicted, relentless, and just as compelling. The writing is tight, the pacing works, and the action still hits hard where it counts.

But... let's talk about the one thing that's been bugging me: the **"budget Spider-Man" acrobatics**. Swinging across buildings with the billy club might look cool in a storyboard, but in practice? It feels completely unnecessary. Daredevil isn't supposed to fly through the skyline - he's the guy scaling walls, dropping into back alleys, and scrapping in hallways. The overdone swinging just breaks the immersion a bit and makes it feel like they're trying too hard to superhero-ify him.

If it weren't for that one stylistic misstep, I'd honestly give this a 10/10. Still, *Born Again* stays true to what makes Daredevil great: raw emotion, brutal fight scenes, and a hero who bleeds - physically and morally. Highly recommend.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: GamerGirlGreen
review:
I literally made an imdb account to write this review.

Overuse of unnecessary CGI, terrible film quality, it looks like it's made by an edgy film student.

I genuinely can't understand why this show looks so incredibly bad. Netflix had it spot on and Disney have just spoiled it.

The charm is gone. The amazing cinematography and gorgeous fight sequences are just.. not there.

It makes me so sad as I was looking forward to seeing more of this character, I could watch the Netflix over and over again but I struggled to even get through one episode here.

Everything about my favourite series has been ruined within the first 15 minutes of this show.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: layekrounak
review:
As everyone is aware, the actors for Foggy Nelson and Karen Page weren't initially called in for this show-they weren't considered an integral part of the story. After watching the first ten minutes, it's very evident why.

I was happy to hear that they had changed the story to include Nelson, Murdock, and Page since there's no Daredevil without them. But it turns out they really haven't. It's the same story as before-they were meant to die, and while they might not show it explicitly, they likely hired the actors just to kill off their characters.

As for the plot, it seems like they'll take the first six episodes to bring Daredevil back and to set up Fisk's downfall. It'll probably end with a big battle between Daredevil and Fisk, with Spider-Man showing up since Spider-Man 4 is in the works. Way to kill off a solid character for barely any reason, Marvel. Gg!

By the way, when is Daredevil coming to Marvel Rivals? I feel like they'll do the character more justice than the MCU will.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: polairous
review: Everything good about the Netflix series has been stripped away. The fight choreography, lighting, cinematography, writing... everything is now 'disneyfied' and unbearable. The cgi isn't just OVERUSED but used so poorly... within the first 15 minutes too üòÇ unreal. Cgi smoke OVER a poorly lit CGI fight scene?? Really guys? I've seen better in STUDENT films.... utterly underwhelming and disappointing, not to mention disney+ adding full 2 minute ads on TOP of a poorly executed show. They should cut their losses and sell it back to Netflix, as this 'reboot' is not worth anyone's time. If you love daredevil... just rewatch the Netflix one.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: tarifulhoque
review_title: It's Good but It could be better
review: I've waited for this series for a long time, and I would say it was definitely worth the wait. The episodes were really good, but I still feel they could have been better. However, I do have a complaint regarding the action sequences-they feel somewhat unsettling and unsatisfactory. The Netflix version was more raw, intense, and grounded in reality, whereas Disney's version feels a bit unrealistic, like something is off. Except for that, the conversations between the characters were very engaging and never felt boring. The tension between two characters was beautifully crafted, making those moments truly captivating.

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: pernix
review_title: Weak copy of the original trilogy
review:
This is the sad result of a production mess. I wanted to like it and hoped to find the same wit and unpredictability of Andor, but it proved impossible.

Right from the beginning, you can sense the glue between the different creative teams that have succeeded one another at the helm of the series. The presence of Foggy and Karen is a brutal plot device used to artificially induce more drama into a rather dull beginning. I don't recognize Kingpin anymore because since Hawkeye, his behavior is not consistent anymore with the original Kingping, and D'Onofrio's acting has become manneristic and lacks the true scariness and unpredictability of the character. What a pity...

title: Daredevil: Born Again
author: DeathWish_Monroe
review_title: Destructions of yet another good show
review:
Just by watching first 15 minutes you can feel cheap CGI, awful camera and theatrical acting. Why, just why they needed to switch from something what eas almost perfect. They lost that "old boy" way of action scenes to some plastic ones. You can feel cheap focus and production.

Oh well what we have expected from the hell mud produced people running superhero movies now.

Delusional mindsets are running this world so this is the least of our concerns now.

And yeah, you can see how machinery is working with highest ratinga now and all praises that will plummet as soon as YT get the hold of this.

title: Ironheart
author: ihearthorror81
review: I love Marvel so I'll be watching all of Ironheart, but I am not pleased with the start. Boring, characters are not interesting. But my main issue is the utter disrespect shown towards Iron Man. One characters asks, "you're smarter than that Tony guy?"...Tony guy?! Does he mean Tony Stark? The man that developed the MCU into over 2 decades into the powerhouse that it is now. The man who used the infinity stones to save trillions of lives throughout the universe? That Tony guy. Pretty sure everyone in the multi-verse knows who Tony Stark is. Pathetic excuse and blatant disrespect for the hero of the MCU. Trying way too hard to be edgy for the sake of being edgy. Hopefully this changes. Not sure who this show is for if it continues to treat the history of the MCU this way. Shame.

title: Ironheart
author: Kayle90
review:
The moral of this show, is you don't have to earn anything.

Riri is amazing, apparently, because everyone says so, but why? Nobody knows, just keep saying she's amazing and it'll stick.

She didn't earn the suit, she's not strong, funny or cool. She's just feels like an NPC who stumbled upon Excalibur laying on the floor and claims she's the king of the world. She helps her fellow students cheat on their tests and projects, seeking her out just to use her to not fail. So she didn't earn anything and she's surrounded by people who didn't earn anything, in fact everyone is just ripping off everyone else, just like Ironheart is a ripoff of Ironman.

Imagine if you went to the valedictorian of your class and said "make this work for me or I'll fail". What kind of message does that send the audience? That it's okay to get by in life if you just let somebody else do your job for you?? That's insane! Tony Stark was the head of a massive successful business and one of the smartest minds on the planet and he didn't need everyone telling him he's amazing. He built a giant mechanical suit in a cave with junk! He made a tiny reactor to keep his heart from getting shredded! Riri simply stole everything! It's like saying "I'm an architect" just because you can put legos together. Awfully terrible start to a mediocre show.

title: Ironheart
author: ppqyqxv
review: Ironheart is a nicely designed & well written piece of Iron Man-esque mcu content that I, a huge Iron Man fan, have been waiting for, especially since production for Armour Wars is at a halt. The show reminds me of Iron Man Armoured Adventures in a way. RiRi is a very well written character with depth & is played AMAZINGLY by Ms. Dominique Thorne. I'm already upset we only have 6 episodes. There are some weirdly edited sequences & the cast of The Hood's crew was obviously carefully casted in order to appeal to a wide audience range, but aside from those 2 nitpicks, i'm in love with this show. Well Done everyone involved.

title: Ironheart
author: Whatever-740
review:
What makes it worse is the show's attempt to erase Tony's legacy rather than celebrate it. Ironheart doesn't treat Tony Stark as a mentor, a blueprint, or even a point of philosophical reflection. Instead, it treats him as an outdated relic-a mere footnote in Riri's story. That's insulting to both the character and the fans who watched him grow over more than a decade of films.

And I get it-new characters need to rise. The torch must be passed. But you don't honor the past by pretending it was irrelevant. You build on it. You respect it. You show that your new hero has something to learn from those who came before. Ironheart skips all that. It acts like it doesn't need the foundation that was built before it. And because of that, it feels hollow.

title: Ironheart
author: magnusman60
review:
It looks slick but it suffers from the same issue all the new marvel stuff does.

It's emotionally flat as a pancake and doesn't connect with the people watching.

It makes the same mistakes of going for making a statement at the cost of the story and characters.

Neither the character development or the story are developed remotely enough to make us care and in fact do the opposite much of the time.

Someone likely realized this which is why it got shelved so long.

It's not acolyte or snow white levels of bad its just meh.

It's a shame really the people involved deserved better but they may have already know it was bad.

title: Ironheart
author: williamnash-25132
review: Oh my those first three episodes were enough for me and I won't be coming back. First off the protagonist of this story can't act but even if she could her character Ree-Ray is insufferable, completely unlikable. She steals when she needs certain things but it's ok because it's for a great cause (right). The supporting actors are really dull and unlikable as well; there's one that's supposed to be intimidating but he's anything but intimidating. The story is horrible, disjointed, and convoluted. I thought I was supposed to be watching a superhero series but the story is all over the place and it's so boring. Oh, and the protagonist is a genius and you'll know because everyone to include herself will let you know.

title: Ironheart
author: somekidzenvy
review:
The word superhero has lost all meaning. This character is just a selfish thief. Everything she does serves only herself. She doesn't do anything good for anyone and the story is a compilation of stereotypes. Right off the bat it leans into her being a bad person and feigning decency. I can't believe this got made.

I won't be finishing this series, i have no one to root for. How can you make a protagonist that is so unlikable and expect a different result?

I hope this is a wake up call for the studio but I doubt it. They keep churning out this processed slop and attack the fans when they don't like it.

title: Ironheart
author: RitchyF
review_title: Love Marvel but this is a head scratcher
review: Honestly went in with the best intentions. I commend the show for getting right into it and skipping over most of the origin while giving little clues, but man is the tone and pace all over the place. Acting may be the worst thing I have seen in any Marvel movie. Not sure if it's the edits that are making it so obvious. Overall very very rough. Marvel should know that when dealing with a legacy character, especially one so intertwined with Tony Stark they would put more plain and simple effort into the story, but they did not do the character any favors whatsoever, sadly. Overall, the studio and fans knew this would be an uphill battle, and unfortunately are proving most of the doubters, correct.

title: Ironheart
author: gsjennings-929-779381
review:
No one in the show is likeable or has any redeemable qualities after watching two Episodes. What are their motivations beyond just get what you can from everyone else, consequences don't matter.

Why is Riri squandering her skills?

Obviously the leader of the gang is the one that likely caused the death of her friend and dad. How will that workout? Will she kill him as well?

What did she learn in Wakanda and why hasn't it stuck with her now that she's back? Why hasn't Wakanda kept watch on her to see if she's struggling? They took an interest in her before, but now nothing?

What about Tony Stark?

So many holes.

1/3 of series in and can't see myself watching much more.

title: Ironheart
author: FreakingPhanter
review: I I recently watched the first three episodes of this series, and I must say that it is definitely superior to a series like "She-Hulk." The acting is commendable, with the cast delivering performances that bring depth and authenticity to their characters. The visual effects are also quite watchable, enhancing the overall viewing experience without overpowering the narrative. The story itself is very decent, offering a compelling plot that keeps viewers engaged and eager to see what unfolds next. I believe that most people are hesitant to accept a new hero in an Iron Suit, as they are accustomed to the iconic Tony Stark. However, this series truly deserves a chance, as it offers a fresh take on the Iron Man legacy.

title: Ironheart
author: ameliapozniak-70100
review_title: Did you even watch the show?
review:
The quality production is fairly good in terms of CGI, which often lacks when it comes to TV shows vs film-and the performances are amazing. Realistically, even if you didn't like one of these aspects, the strengths of the show deserve a 5/10 for sheer quality. Boring people without a sense of individual taste who rate blindly based on internet trends have been given too large a platform for simply having the loudest voices.

The opening setup is clunky at times, and the dialogue had to push some concepts forward in episode 1, a bit aggressively in order to get Riri from where we last saw her, to where she needed to be for the plot to happen, but I'd give all of ten actors a 10/10. Natalie's actress is especially fantastic. Her mannerisms felt so real, evoking real people I've met- in such a visceral way I felt the unease that she is meant to be a recreation.

Compelling tension and conflict within the first 3 episodes. Even if it tanks from here, it had a fiery start worthy of continuing to watch.

title: Ironheart
author: chilly-56548
review: As a Marvel fan since Iron Man kicked off the MCU, Ironheart is a crushing letdown. This show feels like a betrayal of everything that made Marvel great-compelling characters, tight storytelling, and meaningful stakes. Riri Williams is painfully underdeveloped, with zero emotional pull, and the script is a mess of forced quips and recycled tropes that go nowhere. The action is bland, the CGI feels cheap, and the attempt to shoehorn this into the MCU's legacy is insulting. It's a pointless cash grab that adds nothing to the universe I've loved for years. Disney+ needs to do better. Skip this disaster.

title: Ironheart
author: cassandra-17921
review:
Tony Stark aka Iron Man is dead. Let's face it and stop comparing him to Ironheart. Now, let's move on.

Dominique Thorne shines as her role of an extremely talented, smart and quick-thinking Ironheart. The fact that her suit is powered differently and sustainably sets it apart.

There are so many layers to peel through with Ironheart and her family. The supporting cast and their characters are something unlike we've seen this far in a Marvel Studios production. Anthony does an excellent job in his portrayal of Parker.

I can't wait to see ep 4-6 and hopefully Season 2 and/or in Avengers: Doomsday.

title: Ironheart
author: fritzkatie-19447
review_title: A fun modern take on Marvel!
review:
As an enjoyer of the IH comics, this show doesn't stay true to it. But it's alright because this adaptation is fun, quirky, and super addictive. I haven't watched any of the Marvel shows aside from this one, and this one is a total hit for me. Especially with the plot twist & the gut wrenching anxiety I felt through the characters. Can't wait for the rest because it was so so so fantastic. Will be recommending to all of my friends and family who are enjoyers of the Marvel universe.

A huge thank you to the producers and the actors / actresses who made this show so authentic and fun to watch. 10/10.

title: Ironheart
author: isuruamanda
review: One of the most disappointing entries in the MCU to date. Ironheart feels like a lifeless attempt to capitalize on the Iron Man legacy without understanding what made it work. The show struggles with tone, pacing, and purpose.. The plot feels half-baked, the dialogue is uninspired, and Riri Williams lacks the charisma or depth to carry a series. Supporting characters are either forgettable or annoyingly one-dimensional, and the villain is just another generic baddie with no real menace or motivation. It's as if Marvel made this just to tick off a box rather than tell a compelling story. A soulless, forgettable slog that adds nothing to the MCU... Skip it.

title: Ironheart
author: lojnee
review_title: So much worse than I thought it would be
review: I started watching with low expectations and this show still managed to disapppoint me. Horrible acting, irrational storyline, unlikeable characters with nothing that would hook you. I really liked Dominique Thorne in Wakanda Forever and still think she has a lot of potential so I hope she has a bright future but Riri Williams is not it. How she thought ironheart is better than Ironman is beyond me. Ironman was a superhero, ironheart is a criminal and her justification for being a criminal - she needs money. So why doesn't? At no point in the first three episodes did she even try to save her crews victims. Awful.

title: Ironheart
author: DisneyP-5
review:
I am really loving this show so far. It has a lot of heart, the characters all feel real and relatable, it's funny without being silly, and the visuals and effects are very strong.

This is a show that could have easily been cheesy, but they've taken a real grounded approach and it's one of the most refreshing additions to the marvel cinematic universe in an hot minute.

I hope people will give it a chance and not just dismiss it like they so often do these days for their obvious (bias) reasons. It's a good, easily digestible shkw that's worth investing your time to watch.

I'm not excited to see what comes next!

title: Ironheart
author: t-miecz
review:
I had the opportunity to watch the first two episodes a day before the official premiere, and I was pleasantly surprised. The show strikes a strong balance between storyline, action, comedy, and emotional depth.

The acting was solid overall. I recognized a few familiar faces, while others were new to me. I can tell the antagonist has the potential for more complexity, but perhaps the first two episodes didn't require it yet. I'm looking forward to seeing how that develops. The main lead, however, stood out with her ability to convey a wide range of emotions through subtle facial expressions. Truly impressive work.

I read the comic books a few years ago, and I think the writers did an excellent job of drawing from the source material while making the story their own. It feels both fresh and faithful. The narrative remains tight and concise, which is refreshing. Although the plot unfolds in a futuristic and highly advanced universe, the themes feel grounded and relatable, particularly the challenges faced by younger generations, the urgency of Gen Z's desire for change, and the resistance they meet from those in power. That dynamic alone gives weight to the show's premise, ergo the title of this review.

If there's one area where I'd hope for more, it's the action. I understand the importance of setting up the backstory properly, and I trust that it's building toward something bigger. But with a Marvel-sized budget, I did expect a bit more intensity out of the gate. That said, the humor is sharp, and there are enough entertaining moments to keep the pace enjoyable.

title: Ironheart
author: dantework
review_title: I thought it was going to suck based on the trailers and things I was hearing...
review:
But after watching it I am shocked how much I was actually into it. I thought they made Riri an actual character I semi care about now. The whole thing with N. A. T. A. L. I. E. Is my favorite part of the show and actually way more interesting than I ever expected. I think the actors in the show are great so far as well. I also love Joe so far I think they can do some fun stuff there too.

This whole criminal heist ring concept is really fun actually. Something to where her genius abilities actually make sense and are useful.

The only thing I'm not exactly sold on yet is The Hood I was wanting some Ghost Rider demonic dark mystical stuff and it's hinting at that but not enough for my liking. I think the character is way more interesting than the show is making him. And Riri's male love interest is kind of one note and not interesting at all but luckily he is barely a presence in the show. I think we could have done without that.

But I love the rest of the crew Slug and Clown are stand outs so far. I love Riri's mom. I love Joe. Love the whole aspect of community being brought into it with the little boy with the wagon and the owner of the garage.

And I think the trauma of her past is ok not incredibly compelling but also not terrible either. But so far I'm enjoying it more than some MCU things.

I think people decided to hate it without even watching it. And that's a bummer. I don't think it's the greatest thing ever but I also don't think it deserves a 4 out of 10 that is crazy. It is infinitely more entertaining and enjoyable than that. I'd say it's about a 7.5-7.8.

title: Ironheart
author: ttayl-39981
review_title: Seriously, people got paid for this?
review: I'll start off with 1 positive: visual effects were not too bad. Um, now here we go...the acting was horrendous, the storyline appears to be written by a 5 year old; predictable and basically non interesting to watch. It's frustrating to me that people got paid for putting out this garbage. I can't imagine that this was screened in advance for consumer feedback. If you write garbage, then that is what you will see on the screen. I think that any run of the mill marvel super fan could have put together a way better storyline that what was produced. The acting is terrible, I don't expect this series to continue...

title: Ironheart
author: AlfredR-03
review:
It's actually really good. Acting is good. Dominique Thorn kills it. The CGI or VFX is not bad. It also brings back that clunky feel to iron suits that Iron Man 1 had.

The story to me flows well and there wasn't a point in time where I was confused or had to question something happening.

It's only 6 episodes but each episode so far have been a good length of time where it felt too short.

Only watched the first 3 episodes so far. I'm hoping it finishes strong.

Also really nice to see Chicago in the MCU. Waiting for a Portillos mention but I won't hold my breath.

Don't believe the review bombers. Check this show out.

title: Ironheart
author: whitecasper007
review: We got three episodes right away. Finished the first, and I'm hooked. Lots of love went into this. Dominique as Riri Williams is incredible. I'm obsessed with N. A. T. A. L. I. E.! She's just the right kind of comedic relief and sounding board for Riri. Anthony Ramos really surprised me right out the gate for a character I had little familiarity with. The whole crew is delightful. Shea Coule√© as 'Slug' is just the role she needs to break into the real acting game. Absolutely adore her! Cree Summer lends her oh-so-recognizable presence to the show as Ms. Stanton, and her small part has already made me love her. I can't wait to see how the season progresses!

title: Ironheart
author: athornell-00377
review_title: Ironheart gets on base but doesn't score a homerun!
review:
I have edited my original review, because as I am watching episode 4, I feel less excited and engaged.

I have enjoyed Dominique Thorne's intensity and scrappy persona as Ri Ri / IronHeart since Wakanda Forever! With that said; this 'Alice going down the rabbit hole' woe is me theme and storyline is dark and epidemic of other recent Marvel shows.

This fragile and weak super hero or anti-hero storyline- She-Hulk, Ms. Marvel, even Hawkeye (and the Thunderbolts)...it can only go so far Marvel!

Honestly I kept expecting Shuri from Wakanda to show up and save the day. Or I kept hoping...She would save the day and save the characters... What is and isn't working is the narrative explores psychosomatic and social angst of Iron Heart's key characters and how the impact of death as well as identity and power impact people's circumstances and choices.

Hence the Hood (played by Anthony Ramos). He is an intriguing villain that we don't know much about.

The storytelling unfolds at a slow pace, almost too slow in some parts. The action does too.

I want to like this show, but it is hard when I don't like the main character. Ri Ri is suffering from grief and trauma and her own ego and keeps making mistakes out of fear. Which makes it hard for her to be a hero. I guess that's the point Marvel is trying to make? But the fans who are watching this series are suffering in the process. It started out good but seems to have drowned in its' own sorrow.

Marvel get it together and bring back the blockbusters. Put a pause on the dark melodrama TV series. Daredevil is excellent! But everybody and every Marvel character isn't going to score a home-run! Ironheart gets on base but doesn't get off third.

title: Ironheart
author: info-90701
review:
This show suffered from writers who don't understand what makes something dramatic and or interesting, so the writing just drones on and on and on with underwhelming scene after underwhelming scene. There are so many opportunities to make this extraordinary but these people would have to understand enough about creating drama to know how to do that, and they simply do not. This is at every turn, in every scene, and on and on. They seem to believe that savvy tech, and concepts alone will make it interesting, but it doesn't.

I hope they get better writers, soon too, because the basic premise perhaps could be interesting, if . . .

title: Ironheart
author: jbell9384
review:
The character development in Ironheart is one of the series' strongest features. Riri starts off as a brilliant but somewhat guarded teen, unsure of how her abilities fit into the larger picture. As the series progresses, we see her grow in remarkable ways. Her grief over the loss of her father, her complicated feelings about Tony Stark's legacy, and her struggle to balance her own identity against the expectations placed on her - all these elements are explored with nuance. Her evolution feels earned, not rushed, and by the end, Riri isn't just wearing a suit - she's embodying the values that make a true hero.

Supporting characters are not left behind, either. The show does an excellent job fleshing out Riri's community, especially her mother, Ronnie, who adds emotional weight and grounding to the story. Their mother-daughter bond is touching and realistic - full of warmth, tension, and love. Her friends and classmates aren't simply there to fill space; they contribute to the story in meaningful ways that reflect themes of loyalty, sacrifice, and authenticity. Even antagonists like The Hood bring surprising depth and moral complexity, challenging viewers to think more critically about power and justice.

Another standout aspect is how Ironheart balances high-tech action with human emotion. Yes, the armor is sleek, the battles are thrilling, and the stakes are high - but it never forgets that the core of the show is Riri's humanity. The visual effects are impressive, but they never overshadow the story. Instead, the tech becomes an extension of Riri's character - a symbol of both her potential and her inner battles.

The writing deserves particular praise. It's sharp, layered, and emotionally intelligent. The dialogue feels natural, even as it weaves in larger themes of race, class, legacy, and belonging. The show doesn't shy away from social commentary, but it also never feels preachy. It presents challenges without offering easy answers, letting the characters - and viewers - wrestle with the complexity of real-world issues.

title: Eyes of Wakanda
author: DanielJ-722
review_title: What did I just watch on Disney+?
review: It is too mediocre, it does not contribute anything to the universe that we already know and the narratives of the chapters are too generic. Somehow in the last chapter they manage (as always) to play with time travel breaking the rules already established in Avengers Endgame like if marvel didn't remember how the universe they created worked. Most of the characters are too flat and uninteresting to make you care about their fates, which leads to a complete disconnect from the series. I'm giving it one star because I wasn't expecting anything and ended up disappointed somehow.

title: Eyes of Wakanda
author: ranganijay
review:
This is my honest fan review and some constructive criticism, shared in the hope that it helps the creators improve future content.

The visuals, art style, action choreography, costumes, and animation are all impressive. However, the character design and dialogues could have been much better. The background sets for Wakanda also felt a bit lacking in depth and detail.

I feel that the MCU now has a much older and more mature audience than it did at the start. So it would have been better if the story and characters had more depth, with a tone that felt more grounded, realistic, and serious.

It would have helped if the series had explained what the artifacts actually were. They felt a bit dull, just glowing purple stones. I think it would have been more interesting if they had unique purposes or origins. Also, some of the ancient technology didn't feel believable. Having a wireless device in 1000 BCE is just too much. I understand that Wakanda is highly advanced due to vibranium, but that doesn't mean it should be able to create anything without limits.

It would have made more sense if Wakandan technology had evolved in a different way, with unique functions and working styles - not just the same modern tech like button-pressing, flying ships, laser beams, electric bombs, radios, encrypted messages, and trains. These technologies made sense in the Black Panther films because they exist in our world and Wakanda could have advanced versions of them. But in a historical setting, they felt out of place.

Also, Wakandan science and identity should not rely entirely on vibranium. Vibranium should be treated like a resource - like water or electricity - something powerful, but not the whole foundation of their culture or science.

Episode Two was, in my opinion, the best of all. However, the use of Iron Fist felt like a waste. I liked the female version, but her character lacked proper development. The story could have been stronger if not all episodes revolved around the artifacts.

Lastly, please use time travel more carefully. If it's used too often, it loses its impact and meaning.

title: Eyes of Wakanda
author: FazluRahmaanH
review: Really good story and fight scenes from start to finish . All the characters designs just catch the eye the second their let on the screen . A well animated series with very realistic fast paced action . This is enjoyable for people who love animation and for those who have followed the movies before .

title: Eyes of Wakanda
author: jaymanbenltley
review_title: Beautiful, Impactful, and Marvel at Its Most Human
review:
Eyes of Wakanda stands out as a visually stunning and emotionally rich expansion of the MCU, and honestly, I'm baffled at the wave of unwarranted 1 stars it's already receiving. This show is breathtaking-not just in its animation but in its ambition. If you're hearing it's "not worth your time," check that noise at the door and experience it yourself.

From the first episode, it hits like a moving painting: episode one is often described as "premiere energy at its finest," which sets a gripping tone that carries you through all four stories . From ancient Ethiopia to mythic Crete, its painterly, hand-drawn visuals create a style that's rich and textured-no wonder critics have compared it to art brought to life, calling it "moving painting" worthy of a museum .

The show packs action, heart, and culture into tight 30-minute chapters. Characters like Noni and the Lion offer complicated, emotional storytelling, while episode three's ancient Iron Fist arc adds unexpected depth and connectivity to Marvel's broader history . Though some stories feel a bit rushed due to limited runtime, moments shine with real emotional stakes and world-building ambition.

If you've listened to the hype-either good or bad-give yourself a clean slate. Watch Eyes of Wakanda without the internet drama in your ears. You'll find a show that's loud in its beauty, grounded in its themes, and courageous in its storytelling.

Rating: 8/10. Gorgeous, bold, thoughtful, and absolutely deserving of praise. Don't let the noise drown out what this show truly is-it's a rare gem in Marvel's parade.

title: Eyes of Wakanda
author: AbrahamW-5
review_title: A Visually Stunning, Brilliantly Ambitious Marvel Masterpiece
